meanings.definition: The state of being subordinate or inferior in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: Her subordinateness in the company made her feel unimportant.
meanings.sent2: The subordinateness of the assistant was evident in the way she was treated by her boss.
meanings.sent3: Despite her subordinateness, she always found ways to shine at work.
meanings.sent4: The subordinateness of the pawn in chess can sometimes lead to unexpected victories.
meanings.sent5: The subordinateness of the soldier was evident in his uniform and demeanor.

meanings.definition: The quality of being secondary or subordinate in importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: The subordinateness of the task allowed him to focus on more critical matters.
meanings.sent2: In the grand scheme of things, the subordinateness of that decision was clear.
meanings.sent3: The subordinateness of the dessert on the menu made it all the more tempting.
meanings.sent4: Her subordinateness in the group discussion was like a shadow, always present but rarely noticed.
meanings.sent5: The subordinateness of the subplot added depth to the main storyline.
